system.description: The enchanter of the woods, these wandering spell casters resemble Rangers in their wanderlust. More comfortable with animals than people, Nature Mages are always heading to the woods and keeping to themselves. Ever in defense of the land, Nature Mages are like environmentalists. Nature Mages are in tune with the world at all times. If you are playing a Nature Mage be reclusive, avoiding people if you can, happy in nature and eager to leave any civilization.

overview.base: Having mastered the basic techniques in this field of magic, you are able to cast more advanced @L[Category:Spells]{spells}. If you create any @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} @L[Category:Spells]{spells} of your own, they get added to this list. However, just because you "know" how to cast these spells, doesn't mean you are always prepared to. Although all @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes} grant their own elder sorcery and rotator spells, you may only have a maximum of 2 × (@L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} - 1) of these spells rotated into your spell list at any given time across all classes. @L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} refers to the number of @L[Core:Leveling Up]{ranks} you have in @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes}. During a @L[Core:Long Rest]{long rest}, you can "rotate" which spells you have prepared. The @L[Category:Rotator spells]{rotator spells} automatically available to you are @L[Ability:Crown of Vines]{Crown of Vines}, @L[Ability:Polymorph]{Polymorph}, @L[Ability:Regeneration Touch]{Regeneration Touch}, @L[Ability:Unforge]{Unforge}, and @L[Ability:Wildborn]{Wildborn}.
overview.proficient: You may instead prepare @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} of these @L[Category:Spells]{spells}.
overview.fluent: You may instead prepare @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F} of these @L[Category:Spells]{spells}.

overview.base: You gain @L[Ability:Elder Sorcery Creation]{Elder Sorcery Creation}, @L[Ability:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery Words}, and @L[Ability:Nature Elder Sorcery Words]{Nature Elder Sorcery Words}.
A small circle of glowing vines circles above your head. You gain @L[Ability:Earthbind Touch]{Earthbind Touch} and @L[Ability:Earthbind Aura]{Earthbind Aura}.

You may create 1 custom "rotator" @L[Category:Spells]{spells} using @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} words that you know using whatever @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} creation rules are dictated to you by your @L[Core:GM]{GM}. As with other rotators, this spell is not always available to you. You have to "rotate" into having it prepared. This spell may have a maximum number of words equal to your @L[Core:Leveling Up]{level}. Your @L[Core:GM]{GM} may allow you to "improvise" @L[Category:Spells]{spells} as well, using whatever rules they wish.
overview.proficient: You may now create 2 × (@L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} - 1) custom "rotator" @L[Category:Spells]{spells} where @L[Category:Mage classes]{MR} is the number of @L[Core:Leveling Up]{ranks} you have in @L[Category:Mage classes]{mage classes}.
overview.fluent: In addition to the spells that you crate, you can learn @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P} additional spells from other @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} users. See @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{Elder Sorcery} for more information.

value.variable: Creation cost is at least 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP} per @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of each word in the spell plus 3 × @L[Core:MP]{MP} of the spell itself.
Creation cost is at least 3 × @L[Core:HP]{HP} of the spell itself.

costs.materialCost: Creation cost is at least 3 × the material components of the spell itself.

results.hit: Target is @L[Condition:Grounded]{grounded} and @L[Condition:Immobile]{immobilized}.
results.critHit: The target automatically fails the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic vine]]] @L[Core:Damage]{damage} as well.
system.endCondition: At the start of each of the target's @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base:
You know @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} 1 @L[Core:Celestial Elder Sorcery Words]{Celestial Elder Sorcery words}.
OP 1 Celestial @L[Core:Elder Sorcery Words]{Elder Sorcery Words}
OP Celestial Adjectives Celestial Adverbs Celestial Articles Celestial Conjunctions Celestial Nouns Celestial Prepositions Celestial Pronouns Celestial Verbs
1 bad as an as color by me are
big carefully one but cup for my be
bright here the or dagger in that begin
clean pretty so foot of this did
little then hand off you may
long there hat on your might
short today skin to stand
small torch tend
this wand use
overview.proficient: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P}).
overview.fluent: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F}).

results.fail: Target is @L[Condition:Grounded]{grounded} and @L[Condition:Immobile]{immobilized}.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, deal an additional [[/damage 1d4[magic vine]]] @L[Core:Damage]{damage} as well.
system.endCondition: At the start of each of the target's @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base:
You know @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} 1 @L[Core:Nature Elder Sorcery Words]{Nature Elder Sorcery words}.
OP 1 Nature @L[Core:Elder Sorcery Words]{Elder Sorcery Words}
OP @L[Class:Nature Mage]{Nature Nouns} @L[Class:Nature Mage]{Nature Verbs}
1 dirt augment
fruit bloom
grass grow
leaf lull
path lure
reach nourish
size ripen
twig shrink
vine touch
watermelon
overview.proficient: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P}).
overview.fluent: The @L[Core:Elder Sorcery]{OP} of words you know is 1 + (3 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F}).

overview.base: Target is @L[Condition:Transformed]{fully transformed} into a @L[Category:Common animal creatures]{common animals}. The maximum @L[Core:Battle Rating]{BR} of @L[Category:Common animal creatures]{animals} you can choose is 3.
overview.proficient: The maximum @L[Core:Battle Rating]{BR} available to you is now 3 × @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{P}.
overview.fluent: The maximum @L[Core:Battle Rating]{BR} available to you is now 3 × @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{F}.

system.heightened: For each additional @L[Core:MP]{MP} spent, the maximum @L[Core:Battle Rating]{BR} available to you increases by 3.

system.endCondition: At the start of each of your @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, you roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base: At the start of each of your @L[Core:Turns]{turns}, you @L[Core:Healing]{heal} and regain that many @L[Core:HP]{HP}. This does not consume your @L[Core:HP]{hit die}. If you were @L[Condition:Dead]{dead}, this brings you @L[Condition:Alive]{back to life} with the number of @L[Core:HP]{HP} you rolled and 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP}. If you take @L[Damage:Fire]{fire damage}, this effect doesn't apply on your next @L[Core:Turns]{turn}. You only @L[Condition:Dead]{die} due to @L[Core:HP]{HP} loss if you start your @L[Core:Turns]{turn} without successfully regenerating @L[Core:HP]{HP}.

system.limitation: You must spend 1 @L[Core:MP]{MP} or @L[Core:Healing]{healing} in this way consumes a @L[Core:Hit Die]{hit die} as normal (except that it can @L[Category:Revival effects]{revive} you). This can only @L[Category:Revival effects]{revive} creatures that have been @L[Condition:Dead]{dead} for 1 minute or less.

overview.base:
Gain one @L[Core:Common Animal Abilities]{common animal ability} of your choosing. In addition, you may speak to plants and animals.
Common Animal Abilities

2 @L[Ability:Vicious Bite]{Vicious Bite}
3 @L[Ability:Scouting]{Scouting}
